habitat_description:
The range of the Siskiyou Mountains salamander consists of a restricted patch of the Siskiyou Mountains in the upper Klamath River in Siskiyou County, California, to include the surrounding Applegate River watershed in Jackson and Josephine counties in Oregon (Bury and Pearl 1999; Lannoo 2005). This species also occupies Thomson Creek drainage of the Applegate River system on the east side of the valley (Bury 1998). 

This species is strongly associated with rocky talus slopes in areas of mature and late-seral forest (Welsh and Lind 1995; Bury 1998; Ollivier et al. 2001). It is well-known that the largest populations occupy heavily wooded, north facing rocky talus slopes (Brodie 1970; Nussbaum et al. 1983; Green et al. 2013). Individuals have been reported in talus, rocky soils, slopes, under leaf litter, and other cover near talus (Bury 1998; Nussbaum et al. 1983). 

The area occupied measures 35 x 75 km (Bury 1998; Lannoo 2005)
